image.altText: A collage of one man and two women with a splattered watercolour effect in the background.

items.synopsis: Victoria and Western Australia were the first states to legalise voluntary assisted dying. As they prepare for mandatory reviews of their laws, it's renewed the debate about who should and shouldn't be allowed access.

title.children: 'Not dying quick enough': Christine's unknown prognosis means she can't access Voluntary Assisted Dying

image.altText: A neatly groomed Chinese man wearing a suit and blue tie sits at a news conference table.

items.synopsis: China's Foreign Minister Qin Gang disappears from public view, the first time a senior Chinese government minister has been out of the public eye for more than 20 days without explanation.

title.children: Beijing remains silent as foreign minister disappears from public view

image.altText: a woman in a t shirt saying 'warrior', resting her hand on a walking stick

items.synopsis: Only one per cent of rentals in Australia are affordable on the disability support pension, according to the disability royal commission. Add to that the need for accessibility, and the options are more scarce.

title.children: 'We just don't have choices': Priced out of her rental, Rachel may need to share a one-bedder with her adult daughter

image.altText: Irish players training.

items.synopsis: There are four teams staying in Brisbane ahead of the World Cup, and the city is pulling out all the stops to make them feel welcome — from specialty cocktails, to private training facilities.

title.children: With the Matildas in town, Brisbane is already one of the World Cup’s liveliest hubs

image.altText: Premier Daniel Andrews purses his lips during a press conference about the Commonwealth Games. The photo is a tight headshot

items.synopsis: The Victorian government's decision to walk away from hosting the 2026 Commonwealth Games due to cost blowouts has been labelled an embarrassment. The question is, how did it get the numbers so wrong?

title.children: Victoria's Commonwealth Games move presents one big question: How did Andrews get it so wrong?

image.altText: A centrelink sign with on a building with a reflection

items.synopsis: Carers, pensioners and parents receiving childcare support say Centrelink still routinely sends out letters with little explanation about why the debt has occurred.

title.children: Robodebt is dead, but Centrelink debt notices are still causing stress and confusion

image.altText: Man standing in front of giant net carrying large, different coloured plastic bags, stuffed with smaller bags on beach.

items.synopsis: The host of War on Waste takes us behind the scenes of the latest series and discusses what derailed national momentum to reduce waste and how we can get back on track.

title.children: Craig Reucassel learnt two things that shocked him while making the new War on Waste series

image.altText: a photo of a woman holding a flag, in commonwealth games uniform

items.synopsis: A Commonwealth Games stalwart says many athletes will be waking up today wondering, "Is there any point?" after being stripped of the opportunity to complete locally.

title.children: Australian athletes 'heartbroken' by Victoria's 2026 Commonwealth Games cancellation

image.altText: A woman sits under a coat of arms with a blurred face

items.synopsis: The entire National Security Information Act will be considered in Canberra today at an independent inquiry looking into whether the law should be changed or even scrapped.

title.children: Australia's most potent secrecy law is set to come under close scrutiny in Canberra today

image.altText: The wreckage of a plane crash

items.synopsis: A coronial inquest examining a catastrophic plane crash that killed all on board in Far North Queensland has heard the pilot was flying too low and too fast moments before impact.

title.children: Inquest hears plane flew too fast, too low moments before fatal crash

image.altText: Donald Trump stands in front of a US flag

items.synopsis: For the third time this year, former US president Donald Trump has taken to social media to claim he's about to be charged in yet another criminal case. Here's what we know.

title.children: Donald Trump's very bad legal day explained: A 'target letter' and a classified documents hearing

image.altText: A man looks at stock prices through the window of the ASX in Sydney.

items.synopsis: The Australian share market is expected to start its day higher, after US banks reported strong financial results that boosted Wall Street overnight. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX set to rise, Wall Street boosted by major banks' solid earnings

image.altText: A US soldier stands outside of the Peace House

items.synopsis: Tensions between North Korea and West are further complicated by the reported launch of two missiles, and by the reclusive state's detention of a US soldier who crossed the border from South Korea.

title.children: North Korea fires two ballistic missiles, US soldier detained after crossing border was facing disciplinary action

image.altText: A white background has six different cards on it with various images angled for perspective. An FC logo is present.

items.synopsis: The Yes and No cases for the Voice to Parliament, drafted by parliamentarians from each side of the debate. Who kept their facts straight?

title.children: We fact checked some of the claims made by the Yes and No campaigns. Here's what we found

image.altText: The actor Margot Robbie in a pink dress and long blonde hair playing the character Barbie in the movie, standing in a pink set

items.synopsis: It's produced by Margot Robbie, directed by Greta Gerwig and stars Issa Rae as President Barbie — and it's become a cultural moment before it even opens in cinemas. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: 'If you're a lover of cinema, Barbie is cinema': A guide to the cultural moment that is Barbie

image.altText: A serious Asian woman wearing a maroon shirt places water bottles on the roof of a house, hair tied back.

items.synopsis: A small sticker that uses UV light to indicate when contaminated water is safe for drinking is revolutionising life for villagers in South-East Asia.

title.children: The Aussie invention helping Cambodian villagers produce clean drinking water for free

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a blue air force uniform looks grim in front of the side doors to Parliament House.

items.synopsis: Australia's newly minted cybersecurity coordinator pleads with companies not to pay ransoms, saying doing so risks making the nation a rich target for cybercrime.

title.children: Paying ransoms to hackers is a mistake, Australia's new cybersecurity coordinator says

image.altText: A woman smiles while holding a trophy.

items.synopsis: England claims a "moral victory" but not the trophy after defeating Australia in the final ODI, to ensure a drawn Women's Ashes series.

title.children: 'It feels like a moral victory': England beats Australia to draw series, as Aussies retain Women's Ashes

image.altText: Students walk in front of a castle-like stone building with a clock tower centre of picture, on a rainy day.

items.synopsis: Australia's richest universities have some of the country's lowest numbers of Indigenous students, an ABC analysis shows, with enrolments at the elite Group of Eight representing little more than 1 per cent of their domestic students.

title.children: Australia's richest universities are among the poorest at recruiting Indigenous students, an ABC analysis reveals

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

items.synopsis: After good news from the US, the Reserve Bank of Australia now has a chance to cement low unemployment while controlling inflation – without more rate rises, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Even a week ago we couldn't have predicted this, but things are looking up for the economy

image.altText: A man in a skipper's shirt standing in front of a bright blue boat

items.synopsis: The Sunshine Coast concreter was inspired by an incident on a whale watching tour to create an accessible boat so that people of all abilities can get onto the water.

title.children: Queensland skipper brings Good Vibes to disability community with wheelchair-friendly tour boat

image.altText: Four young people wearing beanies and jumpers gather together smiling in an open courtyard next to cobbled street

items.synopsis: What was meant to be a quick scenic holiday to the Himalayan mountain town of Manali turned into a monsoonal disaster trip. But for the people who live here, it could take years to recover, writes South Asia correspondent Avani Dias.

title.children: I've been covering climate-induced disasters across South Asia, then I got caught up in one

image.altText: A boy with a calf.

items.synopsis: Joey wasn't supposed to breathe on his own again after sustaining a brain injury from a horse accident, but today the 13-year-old is on his way to a dairy farming career.

title.children: Doctors told Joey he wouldn't walk or talk again, now he's well on his way to his cattle farming dream

image.altText: Carmy leans over a cardboard pizza box to write something on it.

items.synopsis: Fresh off the back of eight Emmy Award nominations, The Bear returns for a second season. After being hailed by critics as the best show of 2022, season two has to step up to the plate.

title.children: Yes, chef! The Bear has returned. Here's what to know before devouring season two

image.altText: An underwater image of the underneath of a humpback whale, showing a long, tapering and heavily striated belly.

items.synopsis: Scientists and Indigenous rangers are studying why humpback whales are returning to waters off the Northern Territory after decades of being largely absent.

title.children: Humpback whales are returning to NT waters after decades. Experts are trying to understand why

image.altText: Mitsubishi missile

items.synopsis: Visiting members of Japan's Self Defence Force will this week conduct live firing of its most advanced anti-ship missile in Jervis Bay south of Sydney, ahead of large-scale international military exercises in Queensland.

title.children: Japan to conduct live missile firing on Australia's shores

image.altText: Pat Cummins looks at his hat

items.synopsis: After a short delay, this most fascinating of Ashes series heads to Old Trafford, a venue where England's impressive recent record is offset by the fact Australia was last beaten in a Test match there 42 years ago.

title.children: Australia makes a bold selection call as the Ashes head to Old Trafford

image.altText: Black and white portrait of Alamayu as a teenager wearing a suit and tie. His hair hair is combed to a side.

items.synopsis: As a teenager, Prince Alamayu's requests to return to his homeland were denied by the British. Now, over 100 years after his death, Ethiopians are calling for his return.

title.children: 'A portrait of trauma.' The stolen prince whose wish is still being denied

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a black shirt staring at the camera.

items.synopsis: Coffs Harbour Councillor Scott Wolgamot has posted a public apology on Facebook, saying he "abhors domestic violence" and regrets making the comment during a debate about a koala reserve.

title.children: 'I should have chosen my words more carefully': NSW councillor 'regrets' domestic violence remark

image.altText: Emily Mursa and Ben Pears sitting next to each other in front of a sunset

items.synopsis: A woman who had planned her upcoming wedding at Newcastle venue 48 Watt St says she has been left in the dark after the company went into liquidation.

title.children: Young couple $10k out of pocket as popular venue goes into liquidation

image.altText: A cracked yellow line runs across an asphalt road, with low blue buildings and soldiers in the background.

items.synopsis: The US is working to "resolve" the situation after a soldier who was facing disciplinary action crossed the border during a tour in the Joint Security Area, the border village in the demilitarised zone separating the two Koreas.

title.children: North Korea detains US soldier who crossed into the country during a tour

image.altText: The bend, tubular shell of a missile lies in a damaged building.

items.synopsis: Two Ukrainian ports are attacked in drone and ballistic missile attacks,  as retaliation strikes from Russia worsen following an explosion on a crucial Crimean bridge.

title.children: Russia launches air attacks on Ukrainian ports in retaliation for Crimean Bridge explosion

image.altText: An older man with white hair and full beard sits on a tree stump.

items.synopsis: The book Dark Emu ignited a culture war that became extremely personal, with questions raised over Pascoe's Indigenous heritage. The pressure contributed to his separation from his wife.

title.children: Controversy over Dark Emu took a heavy toll on author Bruce Pascoe
